revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 10:48:14.000000000', 'message': "Allow python3 to be used in CentOS 7

CentOS 7 default Python interpreter version is 2.7, but it's
possible to install a Python 3 interpreter from the base
repository.
With this change, if we set DIB_PYTHON_VERSION to 3, we install
the python3 package from base, with python3-libs, python3-pip and
python3-setuptools, and redefine python_path, effectively allowing
Python 3 interpreter to be used in CentOS 7.

Change-Id: Idabfa94c2bff6e0de6daa0866084d5db14d7dcb0

commit_message:
Allow python3 to be used in Debian

Debian default Python interpreter version is 2.7, but it's
possible to install a Python 3 interpreter from the base
repository.
With this change, if we set DIB_PYTHON_VERSION to 3, we install
the python3 package from base, with python3-libs, python3-pip and
python3-setuptools, and redefine python_path, effectively allowing
Python 3 interpreter to be used in Debian.
See a result of the job for building the ipa image here:
https://review.opendev.org/705773

Change-Id: Idabfa94c2bff6e0de6daa0866084d5db14d7dcb0

commit_message:
Basic IPv6 support

This commit fixes stuff related to the fact that most apps require IPv6
addresses to be in brackets. Also now tests that use floating ips are
skipped if IPv6 is configured. FIPs are not supported on IPv6 and we
need to figure out other way to test them.

Implements: blueprint kuryr-ipv6-support
Change-Id: Ic2be3cf93bd9d114af907d26198e8011281bfabf

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 17:14:32.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

When resizing, it's possible to change the NUMA topology of an instance,
or remove it entirely, through different flavor extra specs or image
metadata. Unfortunately we cache the NUMA topology object in
'RequestSpec.numa_topology' and don't update it until we land on a host.
This means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of
the size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation.

Change-Id: I0ca50665b86b9fdb4618192d4d6a3bcaa6ea2291
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1831269

Closes-bug: #1805767
"}, {'created': '2019-06-18 13:07:14.000000000', 'message': "Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

When resizing, it's possible to change the NUMA topology of an instance,
or remove it entirely, due to different extra specs in the new flavor.
Unfortunately we cache the instance's NUMA topology object in
'RequestSpec.numa_topology' and don't update it when resizing. This
means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of the
size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation, ensuring that we revert to the old field
value in the case of a resize-revert.

Change-Id: I0ca50665b86b9fdb4618192d4d6a3bcaa6ea2291
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1805767
"}, {'created': '2019-08-16 13:47:16.000000000', 'message': "Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of the
size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation, ensuring that we revert to the old field
value in the case of a resize-revert.

commit_message:
Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

When resizing, it's possible to change the NUMA topology of an instance,
or remove it entirely, due to different extra specs in the new flavor.
Unfortunately we cache the instance's NUMA topology object in
'RequestSpec.numa_topology' and don't update it when resizing. This
means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of the
size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation, ensuring that we revert to the old field
value in the case of a resize-revert.

Change-Id: I0ca50665b86b9fdb4618192d4d6a3bcaa6ea2291
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1805767

commit_message:
tripleo-container-manage: remove hashed-* from default

Thanks to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706972/ (and the module
itself), we don't have hashed files anymore. The hash is now in the
container file, and we don't have 2 files anymore; which makes things
easier to understand and debug.

This patch updates the doc and the defaults.
For backward compatibility and upgrades, if a file has hashed in its
name, it's still supported and it'll be clean-up.

Change-Id: Ie01d5509a479a726adac6490a5f32ef2df2ccde6

[FIX] Add apparmor to prometheus.

This also fixes Elasticsearch apparmor Jobs.

commit_message:
Lower tempest concurrency

Let's only run 2 concurrency tempest tests to see if we can
decrease the failure ratio for ironic-standlone job

Change-Id: Ifb6258df26236cf376742a051602321e9b67a52c
(cherry picked from commit caa73a1101e5bf1e262f099e81ad25270a549139)

This change replaces the attach_volume cleanup call to
wait_for_volume_resource_status with wait_for_volume_attachment_delete.
This newer waiter method being able to handle cases where multiattached
volumes remain attached and thus marked as 'in-use' after being detached
from another instance.

commit_message:
compute: Use wait_for_volume_attachment_remove when detaching multiattach volumes

This change replaces the attach_volume cleanup call to
wait_for_volume_resource_status with wait_for_volume_attachment_remove
for multiattach volumes. This newer waiter method being able to handle
cases where multiattached volumes remain attached and thus marked as
'in-use' after being detached from another instance.

Closes-Bug: #1858841
Change-Id: I4e9d253cad1b797940c2c1f922b66602ba592416

commit_message:
Make groups documentation part dynamic

The groups.yaml file is now the source of information concerning the
validations groups. The groups information part is now created
dynamically by reading the groups.yaml file.

This patch also fixes the basepython conflict for the tox py37 testenv.

Change-Id: Id199fc250afa0646b1e851581e3a92290f7bcb00
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 42934b9a09e53b562f6c66b69e235ddaeb64f8a9)

subject: mariadb: avoid state management thread death
messages: [{'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2020-02-17 09:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThis itself introduces the possibility of some errors, eg, wrong client creds following cert rotation etc. However, this is overall more robust than the current implementation. As a result, we should still seek to sperate the threads to exist as discrete processes in separate containers, but this is a fine stopgap until then.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-02-17 15:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28275, 'date': '2020-02-17 15:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 09:14:04.000000000', 'message': 'mariadb: avoid state management thread death

The mariadb container launches two threads in addition to the mysql
daemon, one to mantain a configmap containing the Galera Cluster state,
and the other to handle leader elections. These threads die if they
suffer any exceptions talking to the kubernetes apiserver. This can
happen sometimes, e.g. when a k8s control node reboots.

This change logs and ignores the kubernetes.client.rest.ApiException,
allowing the threads to retry and hopefully succeed once the k8s api
becomes available.

Change-Id: I5745a763bb07f719d83a41c1f27be2b76ce998e9
'}]
commit_message:
mariadb: avoid state management thread death

The mariadb container launches two threads in addition to the mysql
daemon, one to mantain a configmap containing the Galera Cluster state,
and the other to handle leader elections. These threads die if they
suffer any exceptions talking to the kubernetes apiserver. This can
happen sometimes, e.g. when a k8s control node reboots.

This change logs and ignores the kubernetes.client.rest.ApiException,
allowing the threads to retry and hopefully succeed once the k8s api
becomes available.

Change-Id: I5745a763bb07f719d83a41c1f27be2b76ce998e9

commit_message:
Default to zero verbosity when using Ansible.

The OpenStack CLI defaults to 1 level of verbosity
which was being directly passed to Ansible methods.
When the CLI is given "-v", the verbosity level is set to 2.
This patch ensures that Ansible will not be verbose by default.
This lowers the amount of RAM a default
deployment/update/upgrade will use along with lowering
log file sizes.

Change-Id: Ic59cc6b2b9b979255c10d71e437afa733517e3e1
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update the minversion parameter.

Update the minversion parameter to use the python -m pip to install
python packages:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#id185

It's recommend to use this. Remove the useless install_command
parameter.

Change-Id: I25a43f463dbfac59a193774d6f90b0ddb73f5268

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-14 08:16:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add retries to update trunk port

In [1] retry of trunk update was added to avoid StaleDataError
exceptions to fail to set trunk port or subports to ACTIVE state.
But it was only partial fix for the issue descibed in related bug
and from [2] we know that it still can happen on high load systems
from time to time.
So I was checking this issue and reported bug again and I found out
that retry was added only in _process_trunk_subport_bindings()
method. But StaleDataError can be raised also in other cases where
the same trunk is updated, e.g. in update_trunk_status() method.

So this commit adds same retry mechanism to all trunk.update() actions
in services.trunk.rpc.server module.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1733197

Conflicts:
    neutron/services/trunk/rpc/server.py

Change-Id: I10e3619d5f3600ea97ed695321bb691dece3181f
Partial-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit ade35a233edb5c9489cc3a68ae00672fb328f63d)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retries to update trunk port

In [1] retry of trunk update was added to avoid StaleDataError
exceptions to fail to set trunk port or subports to ACTIVE state.
But it was only partial fix for the issue descibed in related bug
and from [2] we know that it still can happen on high load systems
from time to time.
So I was checking this issue and reported bug again and I found out
that retry was added only in _process_trunk_subport_bindings()
method. But StaleDataError can be raised also in other cases where
the same trunk is updated, e.g. in update_trunk_status() method.

So this commit adds same retry mechanism to all trunk.update() actions
in services.trunk.rpc.server module.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1733197

Conflicts:
    neutron/services/trunk/rpc/server.py

Change-Id: I10e3619d5f3600ea97ed695321bb691dece3181f
Partial-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit ade35a233edb5c9489cc3a68ae00672fb328f63d)

commit_message:
Rework caluclating percentiles

* store all points for percentiles calculation instead of using graph
  zipper. to do not exceed memory, points are saved to tmp dir by
  chunks.
* also, this patch fixed calculation of avg values at StatsTable

Change-Id: I8fed9bf6a5a210a22fc008437d335cd7e372d3be

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 18:09:51.000000000', 'message': "Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)
(cherry picked from commit 1b021665281b74c865d3571fc90772b52d70e467)
(cherry picked from commit 9ce94844fa6a43368445182bb086876874256197)
"}]
commit_message:
Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)
(cherry picked from commit 1b021665281b74c865d3571fc90772b52d70e467)
(cherry picked from commit 9ce94844fa6a43368445182bb086876874256197)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 18:09:51.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
is not in Rocky the PlacementFixture still comes from nova_fixtures.

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560

commit_message:
Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
is not in Rocky the PlacementFixture still comes from nova_fixtures.

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)
(cherry picked from commit e7109d43d6d6db0f9db18976585f3334d2be72bf)
(cherry picked from commit ecd1e046214e087dd484359f256386a3e8962ec1)

commit_message:
Support QoS by meter action

Currently, QoS is implemented by TC command of HV OS.
This solution has many drawbacks, such as not supported
VLAN network or VMs from same HV.

Meter is a comfortable solution, because it is implemented
in OpenFlow, so it is flexible and exact.

Change-Id: I2373a81ca2c5d6616c0097f15dd59327116db93f
Closes-Bug: #1850609

messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-06 16:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-06 16:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-06 17:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-07 10:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Question: by making this governance.o.o/ideas (instead of governance.o.o/tc/ideas), it's a bit unclear where it falls governance-wise.

Other entries under governance.o.o are all governance bodies (Board, TC, UC), or constructs that derive from governance bodies (SIGs) or directly related to their lifecycle (election).

Who tracks/drives the Ideas ? If it's the TC I feel like this should live under /tc/ideas. If it's a separate group of people, I feel like it should live under /sigs/ideas (probably with a Ideas-Meta SIG to drive it). If it's more of a self-sustaining dashboard with no central authority, then yes it makes sense under /ideas.

Which one is it?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-07 10:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-10 08:47:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Question: by making this governance.o.o/ideas (instead of
 > governance.o.o/tc/ideas), it's a bit unclear where it falls
 > governance-wise.
 > 
 > Other entries under governance.o.o are all governance bodies
 > (Board, TC, UC), or constructs that derive from governance bodies
 > (SIGs) or directly related to their lifecycle (election).
 > 
 > Who tracks/drives the Ideas ? If it's the TC I feel like this
 > should live under /tc/ideas. If it's a separate group of people, I
 > feel like it should live under /sigs/ideas (probably with a
 > Ideas-Meta SIG to drive it). If it's more of a self-sustaining
 > dashboard with no central authority, then yes it makes sense under
 > /ideas.
 > 
 > Which one is it?

Self sustained with no central authority. That's the model."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-10 08:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Publish tarballs artifacts to AFS in parallel

This adds publishing of artifacts to AFS in parallel with the existing
publishing to the static volume.

The additional tasks added to the openstack-artifacts.yaml playbook
have been tested in the project-config-test-artifacts-to-afs test
(results at [1]) and also in an external project
ironic-python-agent-builder (see notes in [2]).  Thus we can have high
confidence it will work.

After this merges, I will manually rsync the old static tarballs data
to the AFS directory (again; it has been sync'd previously) and from
that point on both should be exactly the same.

At that point we can switch the DNS entries for
static.<openstack|opendev>.org (the sites have been created with [3])
to the new server and we will be fully migrated to the AFS volume.  We
can then remove the static publishing.

[1] http://files.openstack.org/project/tarballs.opendev.org/openstack/project-config/afs-copy-test/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/705161
[3] https://review.opendev.org/704913

Change-Id: Ia3a0358249e9ed3d766b1b61535f2f6d67d4eb2d

commit_message:
Refactoring: finish splitting do_node_deploy

This change splits ConductorManager.do_node_deploy into two new
functions: validate_node and start_deploy. The only small behavior
change is validating that an FSM action is possible before making
any changes (previously we did it in the very end, potentiall after
modifying a node).

Change-Id: I635a30264f25d758850fd57c0f07e7a68b332fe3

commit_message:
"fix" GenericHardwareManger unit test failure

In the interest of keeping CI happy, and reducing the need for
wasteful rechecks, I've changed a test which was increasingly
seeing unit test failures on py37 and py38 testing.

This test functionally still does what is required, validates only
one thread would be utilized by default, but doesn't do output
validation since the calls, threading, and mock interaction were
leading to test failures.

Change-Id: Ia658e0aba001d6195cafeb4484b176e9147e3c26

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 12:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ACLs for deliverables no longer under RelMgt

syntribos (Security SIG) and python-tempest-conf (Interop WG) are
not handled by the release management team (which handles OpenStack
release deliverables only).

nova-powervm, networking-powervm and ceilometer-powervm are deliverables
from the new PowerVMStackers SIG, and should also no longer be under
centralized release management from now on.

Adjust ACLs to allow those projects to be tagged directly.

Change-Id: Ib47416608d6bfe0f0179bbd201d90ada86463e5f

nova-powervm, networking-powervm and ceilometer-powervm are deliverables
from the new PowerVMStackers SIG, and should also no longer be under
centralized release management from now on.

Adjust ACLs to allow those projects to be tagged directly.

Change-Id: Ib47416608d6bfe0f0179bbd201d90ada86463e5f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ACLs for deliverables no longer under RelMgt

syntribos (Security SIG) and python-tempest-conf (Interop WG) are
not handled by the release management team (which handles OpenStack
release deliverables only).

nova-powervm, networking-powervm and ceilometer-powervm are deliverables
from the new PowerVMStackers SIG, and should also no longer be under
centralized release management from now on.

Adjust ACLs to allow those projects to be tagged directly.

Change-Id: Ib47416608d6bfe0f0179bbd201d90ada86463e5f

commit_message:
Disable direct releases in js-openstack-lib ACL

js-openstack-lib (recently added to OpenStackSDK) still had an ACL
allowing for direct tagging, which can create issues when mixed with
openstack/releases-driven release management.

Change-Id: I51904b1b654f6c59d612321a07e5128ae379f066

subject: Stop running py2-based jobs for devstack-gate
messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-02-17 11:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-17 11:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 11:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Stop running py2-based jobs for devstack-gate

The python2-based jobs from integrated-gate are failing now since
Neutron requires py>=3.6. So drop that template from the devstack-gate
project.

The alternative would be to run those jobs against a stable branch
instead master, but that would be non-trivial since devstack-gate is
branchless.

Also the expected remaining lifetime of ds-gate is limited, since it is
a current community goal to convert all legacy jobs to new versions,
which will obsolete the devstack-gate code. With that argument I also
refrain from moving the whole job setup into the project itself, as we
would do with any project that still has a future.

Change-Id: If094fcc31929193eb8278bdbb182e24aa506cca7
'}]
commit_message:
Stop running py2-based jobs for devstack-gate

The python2-based jobs from integrated-gate are failing now since
Neutron requires py>=3.6. So drop that template from the devstack-gate
project.

The alternative would be to run those jobs against a stable branch
instead master, but that would be non-trivial since devstack-gate is
branchless.

Also the expected remaining lifetime of ds-gate is limited, since it is
a current community goal to convert all legacy jobs to new versions,
which will obsolete the devstack-gate code. With that argument I also
refrain from moving the whole job setup into the project itself, as we
would do with any project that still has a future.

Change-Id: If094fcc31929193eb8278bdbb182e24aa506cca7

commit_message:
Update branch checkout and u-c.txt for Octavia

Octavia has a diskimage-builder element to install the amphora-agent.
When creating an amphora image from an Octavia stable branch, the
expectation is the amphora-agent code will match the same branch (master
or stable). However, the amphora-agent always pulls master versions of
upper-constraints.txt and of the Octavia Git repository.

This patch updates the branch name and upper constraints for the
amphora-agent in Octavia on stable branch creation.

Change-Id: I8eba64c886c187c8652f94735ca6153702203d17

[{'created': '2020-02-13 12:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client and
OVN Octavia provider driver.

It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) Add a member to LB that has FIP already
   configured - checks if a member has FIP
   and centralize it.
4) The reverse of each of the above cases.

In addition I needed to extend OVN LB member external_id
entry to add an information about member subnet_id
in order to easly track member port from mechanism OVN
driver.
That means I needed also to support both old and new
conventions. This patch adds also this code.

Old convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`

New convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`_`subnet_id`

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

Related-Bug: #1860662

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef

commit_message:
Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client and
OVN Octavia provider driver.

It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) Add a member to LB that has FIP already
   configured - checks if a member has FIP
   and centralize it.
4) The reverse of each of the above cases.

In addition I needed to extend OVN LB member external_id
entry to add an information about member subnet_id
in order to easly track member port from mechanism OVN
driver.
That means I needed also to support both old and new
conventions. This patch adds also this code.

Old convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`

New convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`_`subnet_id`

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

(Cherry-picked from networking-ovn 57ac38921efa6bbf0bc4a22950355256cc3ebe6d)

Related-Bug: #1860662

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated verify-tempest-config CLI

Tempest CLI verify-tempest-config was deprecated
4 years ago.

With assumption of all the users of this CLI have
moved to new CLI 'tempest verify_config', it is
time to remove the old deprecated CLI now.
'verify_tempest_config' should be now used as
'tempest verify_config'

The following commit gives the idea of deprecation
message:-
https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/e45aa842bc823b56560af247eb5e26b1fd686151

Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic3dbd6f5e854e017a5bec4b1a625730ab68e767d

[{'created': '2020-01-20 21:25:41.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid KeyError when deleting NPs

It seems that when an namespace deletion fails for some reason and
it is retried, if there are other NPs created, some of the unused
ports can be reused and moved from one sg_key to another, therefore
raising the KeyError on the retry.

This patch ensure that if the sg_key was already deleted, the retry
skips it instead of failing

Change-Id: Ifcebf7660861738128606342dc6dab00186878b5
Closes-Bug: 1860106
(cherry picked from commit 453e0d8f35af23f42ef5f72f9f401c5be47488c3)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid KeyError when deleting NPs

It seems that when an namespace deletion fails for some reason and
it is retried, if there are other NPs created, some of the unused
ports can be reused and moved from one sg_key to another, therefore
raising the KeyError on the retry.

This patch ensure that if the sg_key was already deleted, the retry
skips it instead of failing

Change-Id: Ifcebf7660861738128606342dc6dab00186878b5
Closes-Bug: 1860106
(cherry picked from commit 453e0d8f35af23f42ef5f72f9f401c5be47488c3)

commit_message:
Add missing waiter to test_tagged_attachment

test_tagged_attachment was failing when Tempest was set to connect
via fixed IP. The test was trying to attach an interface to an
instance that was still in the building state. Adding a 'wait_until'
to the method creating said instance fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ia1252a22c54e3a84a8e5e779ed6ea5ee593760da
Closes-Bug: #1860680

commit_message:
Removal of deprecated argument[os-tenant-name]

Use of os-tenant-name or OS_TENANT_NAME is deprecated.
Instead of it, os-project-name is expected to be used.

This patch depends on below mentioned patch, since
devstack still uses the deprecated argument.

Depends-on: I624e1dc57a3d3533322fb298c01f70241d0400ed
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3b926f8abb6fce3d2eab93310ce3959c68aa9a6d

commit_message:
Make OVN job voting

There's no point to keep non-voting jobs on the gate pipeline and this
commit makes sure that OVN job there is voting.

Change-Id: I1fddc58d30e8d38f7922fe48f8e57453f82d72ef

commit_message:
[RHEL-8] Update release file with new image server address

Since we are moving to vexxhost and the current rdo cloud rcm
server is getting retired and replaced with new image server.

The new url is https://images-vexxhost.rdoproject.org:4433.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1538

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707574/

Change-Id: I11148ac0a069c8c0167e51618d973c8193b8558f
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

need to test this to make sure the stack action is still 'UPDATE' during the converge step."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-02-13 13:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we should go with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705642/ and avoid unnecessary disruption here.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-02-17 13:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

rendered unnecessary by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705642/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-12 14:21:10.000000000', 'message': "Always restart ovn_metadata_agent on update converge

Due to LP bug #1861799, the haproxy wrapper script is not be updated
with the proper container image name at the time when the ovn metadata
agent is first restarted. If there are no configuation changes to the
ovn metadata agent, the update converge step will not the restart the
agent and it will continue to use the old haproxy wrapper script until
it is restarted for some reason. As a workaround, this patch forces a
restart when the stack is updating.

Note: this only applies to train and earlier - ussuri uses a system
where the script in the agent's container does not have the image name.

Change-Id: I2b39e13606a303f5adf46380edf5c5ddd3f6047a
Related-Bug: #1861799
Related-Bug: #1860571
"}]
commit_message:
Always restart ovn_metadata_agent on update converge

Due to LP bug #1861799, the haproxy wrapper script is not be updated
with the proper container image name at the time when the ovn metadata
agent is first restarted. If there are no configuation changes to the
ovn metadata agent, the update converge step will not the restart the
agent and it will continue to use the old haproxy wrapper script until
it is restarted for some reason. As a workaround, this patch forces a
restart when the stack is updating.

Note: this only applies to train and earlier - ussuri uses a system
where the script in the agent's container does not have the image name.

Change-Id: I2b39e13606a303f5adf46380edf5c5ddd3f6047a
Related-Bug: #1861799
Related-Bug: #1860571

commit_message:
Ensure lb SG is not updated on member creation

When enforce_sg_rules is not set the member creation should not trigger
loadbalancer security group rules update. This patch ensures the
action is not triggered in such a case.

Closes-Bug: 1860145
Change-Id: I0d5f6ffd47fe0a1ae998aa4a61a9240ce0accd40
(cherry picked from commit 8efde71bafcf28f3007e5ea7674c6e2edae357b8)

commit_message:
dhcp-agent: equalize port create_low/update/delete priority

Low port delete priority may lead to duplicate entries in network
cache if IPs are reused frequently.
Also can't find a strict reason why it should be of lower priority.

Change-Id: I55f858d50e636eb9091570b256380330b9ce9cb3
Related-bug: #1862315
Related-bug: #1828423

commit_message:
Fix upper and lower constraints

- Mistral has some newer lower requirements.
- Adds the upper contraints file in the 'deps' tox attribute.
- Removes 'VIRTUAL_ENV' environment variable, which is useless here.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia0c67c5980a7e6bc9006a24be775ea6fb815d23c
(cherry picked from commit 9b69f08a6f07785e11b3166df2f8c37ce1b005be)

commit_message:
Update the new rcm image server url

Since we are moving to vexxhost and the current rdo cloud rcm
server is getting retired and replaced with new image server.

The new url is https://images-vexxhost.rdoproject.org:4433.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1538

Change-Id: Id6ed3092d70d85bbb0e38159b0b23addec48146c
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make all tools run with python3

Change the remaining python tools to use python3 in the shebang, so that
we can run without python2 being installed at all.

Also make the output of worlddump work without encoding errors.

Change-Id: Ib9c17977603c850f3e907f22cccb7d23b0f74ff3

where the openstacksdk installed on the keystone container host.

piece of code being moved to the ansible os_ modules in which would complain
about python-keystoneclient not being on the keystone container host due to
the same deployment circumstances.

commit_message:
Delegate identity provider setup to service setup host

This patch delegates tasks setting up a keystone identity provider to the
keystone_service_setup_host becasue the ansible modules used require the
python-keystoneclient module. These tasks will fail when the keystone
(container) host is not the deploy host as python-keystoneclient will
be missing.

These tasks have recently been refactored in a previous patch [1] to use
the os_* ansible modules instead of the OSA specific keystone module.
This patch fixes a reported bug with the old code which is also present
after that refactoring.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656397/

Change-Id: I16a61501a0578e87464e8bd1031af4270eac2d98
Closes-Bug: #1856165

As I see it, there are four use cases you *might* be wanting to cover, and I'm not completely clear which ones this spec is addressing.

- Landing all of an instance's VCPU and/or MEMORY_MB on the same NUMA node.  This we can do with the modeling you've suggested by requesting the resources in the same numbered request group.
- Landing VCPU/MEMORY_MB *and* some device (VGPU, VF, etc.) on the same NUMA node.  This we can NOT do without further invention when the resources are in separate providers.  We would need some concept of "same subtree".
- Explicit sharding across more than one NUMA node.  E.g. I want *exactly* X VCPUs on one NUMA node and Y VCPUs on a *different* one.  This we can't do via placement without adding the concept of "force resources1 and resources2 to land on *separate* providers".  We could do it post-placement (e.g. in the NUMATopologyFilter or elsewhere in the scheduler) by filtering out the allocation candidates that aren't appropriately sharded.
- Maximizing the chance of my instance landing *somewhere* when I don't care about NUMA affinity, and I don't mind whether it lands on a host that's set up for NUMA or not.  This we can do under the modeling you've suggested (but non-NUMA hosts still modeled with all their VCPU in the root CN RP) by translating VCPU=N into resources1=VCPU:1...resourcesN=VCPU:1.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

So I'm not going to block this, but my gut feeling on this is that we need to do 'can_split' for this to proceed. Looking at the notes cdent recorded on that decision, it seems the reason we didn't proceed with that work was because there wasn't significant feedback from operators when asked about NUMA in placement [1]. If we've now decided that we really care about NUMA in placement then why aren't we reviving the 'can_split' work as part of that? Without doing this, we end up having to develop hacky multiple query workarounds like the one suggested here. I think if we spent time adding that functionality to placement this cycle, we'd be able to close this out easily. In fact, we could still proceed with the memory modelling rework this cycle, in the knowledge that the NUMATopologyFilter would still be needed to add NUMA semantics to things.

Lmk what you think

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006726.html"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

More notes on can_split at [1][2][3]

[1] https://anticdent.org/placement-update-19-21.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006726.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658510/'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

The alternative to can_split is, IMO, to clearly delineate between NUMA and non-NUMA hosts. Only NUMA guests (explicit or implicit) will land on the former, and only non-NUMA guests will land on the latter. In short, if you want to use huge pages or CPU pinning, you need to accept that you might have to configure explicit NUMA topologies for things like larger guests.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-02-13 12:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(8 comments)

I didn't mark them all inline, but there were a number of places "defer to implementation" was suggested. For something like "the name of the workaround option" that's fine, but some of the issues absolutely need to be agreed upon here in the spec.

My -1 is for the conf opt defaults, which I feel pretty strongly are backwards as currently written.

@Stephen:

> If we've now decided that we really care about NUMA in placement then why aren't we reviving the 'can_split' work as part of that? Without doing this, we end up having to develop hacky multiple query workarounds like the one suggested here.

For me, it's a matter of moving the ball. The proposed design (hacky multiple query workarounds included) gets us 80% of the way there *relatively* easily. If we block on can_split, we'll stall this effort for at least another release. Not because putting features into Placement is hard -- case(s) in point: nested magic 1 -- but because can_split is hard.

> In fact, we could still proceed with the memory modelling rework this cycle, in the knowledge that the NUMATopologyFilter would still be needed to add NUMA semantics to things.

Right, that's where we were at PS16, until we started considering the upgrade implications more closely.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-02-13 16:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2020-02-13 18:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-02-13 20:06:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

and one or more Non-Uniform Memory Access (NUMA) nodes (aka. cells)

commit_message:
Revert "Add "ncat" rootwrap filter for debug"

This reverts commit 0ef4233d891f8fa42a073901051bf0310f61eebb.

This patch is introducing a redundant filter already present in
"testing.filters". The problem described in the related bug should
be solved in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707697/.

Related-Bug: #1862927
Related-Bug: #1863213

Change-Id: I4de37364a6fb0184230a9742daced40e4edbfb30

commit_message:
Deprecated the yamlutils module.

The pyyaml is now safe by default:

https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/pull/74/files
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-18342

So the yamlutils is now useless. We can depracated it and then remove it.

Change-Id: I4ecb34eee942c714d09d2258db80f5b8d61dec89

commit_message:
disable DNS integration

This avoids error messages if the dns extension is loaded:

2019-05-23 15:22:18.507 860995 ERROR neutron.api.v2.resource     return f(*dup_args, **dup_kwargs)
2019-05-23 15:22:18.507 860995 ERROR neutron.api.v2.resource   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/neutron/db/l3_db.py", line 1406, in create_floatingip

[{'created': '2020-01-12 08:45:14.000000000', 'message': 'Drop unittest2 usage

unittest2 was needed for Python version <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite some time now. See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest package.

Change-Id: I89185990cf2a751b491763a2c4e144f233404fe6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Drop unittest2 usage

unittest2 was needed for Python version <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite some time now. See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest package.

Change-Id: I89185990cf2a751b491763a2c4e144f233404fe6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pass image import conf file to command which runs glance server

Glance recently has added plugin framework in which a new configuration file
has been added named glance-image-import.conf

In order to get this file read by glance api it need to be passed
to command running on glance_api container.

Closes-Bug: 1790090
Change-Id: I2a7861094bbc814ccd3ef3f2206dc141229411fc
(cherry picked from commit 2b78110ee9957257de57b988a7274d19d4b8209c)

[{'created': '2020-01-28 19:47:36.000000000', 'message': "Do not force remove containers

Paunch does docker/podman rm -f, when removes containers. It seems it
returns too early, having some leftovers (like docker service
endpoints) behind or pending for it to be removed later, in case of
big fat deamons.

Long story short, don't do rm -f and allow it to do its job gracefully
and without a hurry.

Conflicts:
    paunch/runner.py
    paunch/tests/test_builder_compose1.py
    paunch/tests/test_runner.py

Change-Id: I346c49cb204f273bd7077ca5153412cda9846534
Closes-Bug: #1860004

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3813fc7f2bd5768248f7c450d707a13c33f19fc3)
(cherry picked from commit d56765a0aff2f8cf5761a26de86a0ec3a2e5bd0f)
(cherry picked from commit 7a002698561ee65e4e36bf2084043e211ca80ecb)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not force remove containers

Paunch does docker/podman rm -f, when removes containers. It seems it
returns too early, having some leftovers (like docker service
endpoints) behind or pending for it to be removed later, in case of
big fat deamons.

Long story short, don't do rm -f and allow it to do its job gracefully
and without a hurry.

Conflicts:
    paunch/runner.py
    paunch/tests/test_builder_compose1.py
    paunch/tests/test_runner.py

Change-Id: I346c49cb204f273bd7077ca5153412cda9846534
Closes-Bug: #1860004
Co-authored-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3813fc7f2bd5768248f7c450d707a13c33f19fc3)
(cherry picked from commit d56765a0aff2f8cf5761a26de86a0ec3a2e5bd0f)
(cherry picked from commit 7a002698561ee65e4e36bf2084043e211ca80ecb)

commit_message:
Update Neutron Grafana dashboard

This patch reflects recent changes in neutron CI jobs configuration
by adding to the dashboard new jobs:
* neutron-von-tempest-ovs-release
* neutron-von-tempest-ovs-release-ipv6-only (non-voting)
* openstack-tox-py38 (non-voting)o

removing from the dashboard jobs:
* test-release-openstack
* networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7 (non-voting)
* neutron-centos-7-tripleo-standalone (non-voting)

This patch also renames "Scenario jobs failure rates" to be
"Neutron tempest plugin failure rates" graph and moves
neutron-tempest-plugin-api job from the
"Integrated tempest failure rates" graph to this new one.

Change-Id: Id5c5ea4f0bcb0419e3fd13172220fff385c8ee16

commit_message:
retire coreos-image-builder

Removing coreos-image-builder as it was never
really put into use.

As such, we're moving to retire it.

Please see: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707181/

Change-Id: I50574d142e246e3256d90c6d0aa7295655e05d43

This is a combination of 3 fixes, which are all needed to fix the gate.

Neutron constrained the version of hacking < 1.2.0, but since then the
unit tests fails with:

requirements, so update that.

commit_message:
Cap hacking, add bindep.txt and update sphinx requirement

This is a combination of 3 fixes, which are all needed to fix the gate.

1. Adjust version constraint of hacking

Neutron constrained the version of hacking < 1.2.0, but since then the
unit tests fails with:

ERROR: Double requirement given: hacking<1.2.0,>=1.1.0 (from -ri https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/raw/branch/master/test-requirements.txt (line 4)) (already in hacking>=1.1.0 (from -r [..]networking-powervm/test-requirements.txt (line 4)), name='hacking')

So let's simply use the same constraint as set in neutron.

2. Add bindep.txt

...to fix building lxml

(cherry picked from commit ed11ef916d415ea060ca92afa0521f863714ffec)

3. Update sphinx version constraints

Since we touch requirements file with this patch the requirements-check
job also runs and does not find the matching python2 and python3 sphinx
requirements, so update that.

NOTE(elod.illes): libz-dev binary dependency also needed otherwise
lower-constraints target fails.

Change-Id: Ic4d97db6c947264806e5ef9e35f21f764cbecf46
(cherry picked from commit a00fc731b14bd3ef953fe4cffdc74c8e441c0e13)
(cherry picked from commit 032cd43638fa190aa26ca564b71f293de7a74bb9)
(cherry picked from commit 2ae8ceb4eef451cc869982ef09266d33715c60e9)

Hi Victor, Eric and Lee,

Thank you for review. I have modified the specs after discussion in PTG. Kindly have a look at Patch 7.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-18 09:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Kindly review the spec!!!'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-07-02 09:37:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

For when ceph is the nova backend, this makes total sense.

However, I am not sure this works when you have an object store backend, like swift. You want to use the glance default back end, in the hope it is closer to you. Its a full copy that is uploaded to glance, so its a bit different to the use case you describe.

Hopefully it would be a small change to make this dynamic based on the image backend. I don't think we need an operator setting for this just yet, as these seem like two sensible sets of default behaviour."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-07-02 09:37:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

For when ceph is the nova backend, this makes total sense.

However, I am not sure this works when you have an object store backend, like swift. You want to use the glance default back end, in the hope it is closer to you. Its a full copy that is uploaded to glance, so its a bit different to the use case you describe.

Hopefully it would be a small change to make this dynamic based on the image backend. I don't think we need an operator setting for this just yet, as these seem like two sensible sets of default behaviour."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-07-02 09:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi John,

Thank you for the review.

So as per your comment, if direct snapshot is used (i.e. ceph backend is used) then it should identify the glance store based on base image id else it should upload the sanpshot to default backend?'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-07-02 11:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-07-03 14:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Abhishek yes, that is what I was thinking.

In some ways the proposal I am making is a much smaller change than what is proposed in the current version of this spec.

So my proposal is everything stays like it does today (we upload to the default glance store), except when doing a thin shapshot with ceph ephermal disk backend directly, we tell glance which ceph backend we used, which will be whatever the instance disk is currently hosted on.

This should not break the fact that each glance node is uploading to its "prefered" backend, but given the multi backend support, you can now download that as required in any of the places.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-07-04 04:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> @Abhishek yes, that is what I was thinking.
 > 
 > In some ways the proposal I am making is a much smaller change than
 > what is proposed in the current version of this spec.
 > 
 > So my proposal is everything stays like it does today (we upload to
 > the default glance store), except when doing a thin shapshot with
 > ceph ephermal disk backend directly, we tell glance which ceph
 > backend we used, which will be whatever the instance disk is
 > currently hosted on.
 > 
 > This should not break the fact that each glance node is uploading
 > to its "prefered" backend, but given the multi backend support, you
 > can now download that as required in any of the places.

Hi John,
In case of direct-snapshot case i.e. when nova and glance are using same rbd pool, nova just gives add location call to glance to add the location of the snapshot/image.

At glance side we are making change to location API [1] which will identify the store information based on location URL and update the same in the metadata.

So in this case if you don't want the snapshot of an instance which is booted using other images which are not using ceph to upload to specific store then I guess we don't need to do any change at nova side.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/617229'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-23 16:56:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Abhishek & John. Please note that spec freeze is this Thursday, July 25th. I'm not sure, but it seems like you might each be waiting on the other to take the next action. Please let me know if there's anything I can do to facilitate closing on this one way or another."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

We might need to revisit this once glance-store version 1.0.0 is released and multiple stores are in use. If this is urgent in case of nova I can apply for FFE. Kindly let me know.

Thank you for all your support.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 22:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change proposes a spec for the Train release, which is currently under spec freeze. If you still wish your spec to be considered for Train, you may restore it and follow the spec freeze exception process per [1]. Alternatively, you may propose your spec to the backlog per [2], or wait until the U release opens and propose it there.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/008060.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#backlog-specifications'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-30 13:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The nova-specs repository has been populated for ussuri. You may restore and move this spec if needed.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-07 06:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-11-07 07:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

As discussed and agreed at the PTG, we're on the call to instead of having Nova managing the location strategy, we leave Glance just having its own location strategies and Nova just proposing an affinity information based on the existing image ID.

It would just be a client change and nova just passing the original image ID, that's it."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-14 05:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-30 18:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Can reviewers have another look at this please?'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-01-31 10:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Vlad, Thank you for review.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-02-10 12:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

LGTM, Abishekk, please provide a follow-up patch for the asked nits and I'll +2 it ;)"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-02-13 20:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2019-08-06 08:55:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix upload volume to glance

We were missing the 'compress' parameter in the upload_volume method,
yet we were passing it on the driver, which meant that the call would
always fail with:

  TypeError: upload_volume() got an unexpected keyword argument
  'compress'

Related-Bug: #1824821
Closes-Bug: #1839069
Change-Id: Ibe9a0e78ab452c54cc3f1da1f4377034190dd14e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix upload volume to glance

We were missing the 'compress' parameter in the upload_volume method,
yet we were passing it on the driver, which meant that the call would
always fail with:

  TypeError: upload_volume() got an unexpected keyword argument
  'compress'

Related-Bug: #1824821
Closes-Bug: #1839069
Change-Id: Ibe9a0e78ab452c54cc3f1da1f4377034190dd14e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 15:05:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nova::network::neutron::dhcp_domain

The removal of dhcp_domain parameter in nova::network::neutron
was reverted ans pended because of the failure in tripleo, but
as tripleo now use the newer parameter under nova::metadata,
we can safely drop the parameter now.

Change-Id: Iaaf0c3fe4312915e59b5b1680e63f925f6c8511a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove nova::network::neutron::dhcp_domain

The removal of dhcp_domain parameter in nova::network::neutron
was reverted ans pended because of the failure in tripleo, but
as tripleo now use the newer parameter under nova::metadata,
we can safely drop the parameter now.

Change-Id: Iaaf0c3fe4312915e59b5b1680e63f925f6c8511a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-20 06:35:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE to set CPU mode

In same cases, the hypervisor presents to the guest OS a named CPU model
is similar to the host CPU and adds extra features to approximate the
host model. However, this does not guarantee all features will be
precisely match.

This patch adds LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE to allow users to define the CPU mode
they want to use, for example "host-passthrough".

Change-Id: I83792c776b50d1d22584be2a37cc6a166f09c72b

commit_message:
Add LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE to set CPU mode

In same cases, the hypervisor presents to the guest OS a named CPU model
is similar to the host CPU and adds extra features to approximate the
host model. However, this does not guarantee all features will be
precisely match.

This patch adds LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE to allow users to define the CPU mode
they want to use, for example "host-passthrough".

Change-Id: I83792c776b50d1d22584be2a37cc6a166f09c72b

commit_message:
Add support for service_token_roles in authtoken

Add support for service_token_roles in authtoken middleware, so that
we can customize roles assigned to users, which use service user token
feature.

Change-Id: I4376f16e11e9749e55ad36a124777ea0d8686e45

commit_message:
Add lite spec to fix unlimited share replicas per share

This patch adds a lite specification describing the unlimited share
replicas per share issue and describes the proposed solution.

Change-Id: I8f8819ddb7200ff3104ed01cdaa3fd31b670dad2

commit_message:
Add efi packages for ironic-agent

On IPA we are using efivar and efibootmgr, we already added the
packages on ipa-builder.
Adding the pacakges on diskimage-builder, so that people who use
it to build the images won't get into trouble.

the keystone region where octavia user is created.

commit_message:
Add dependency for enable KSM for RHEL/CentOS8

With the OS change to version 8, the qemu-kvm-common package
name changed to just qemu-kvm-common instead of qemu-kvm-common-ev
or qemu-kvm-common-rhev. This adds a condition for the major
OS version.

Change-Id: Idd69c687232a10fcb6db79a8b835a1576b7558dd
Closes-Bug: #1862921
(cherry picked from commit cfb00c9cfe7656d307b6504197feb600a177e431)
(cherry picked from commit a885c0e17a325ad6f823189c80578c0b216db00a)

commit_message:
Deprecate glance::registry

Because glance-registry was deprecated in Queens release[1], deprecate
glance::registry class to configure the service.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/queens/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html

Change-Id: Ifb3bbd3a07ccddafa757cfbc1bec358f49a95c65

commit_message:
Add tempest-python3 job

Run a Python3 job variation of tempest-full as well to ensure
that we don't break either py2 or py3 on constraints updates.

Change-Id: I95c0a3b14d890bfbb3e7f30812450b5c1398772f

commit_message:
Bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in UC

Diskimage-builder (DIB) is a branch-less project. Unfortunately pip
made a change that required a modification to DIB[1]. This patch was
first released in DIB 2.30.0.
To fix image building on the OpenStack stable branches, we need to
bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in the upper-constraints.txt of
the stable OpenStack releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695823/

Change-Id: I1ecbc47f6344749e73720d982700368be227fbd0

commit_message:
Implement utils.copy_clouds_yaml

copy_clouds_yaml is a new function that will be used to copy
/etc/openstack/clouds.yaml which is now generated by Ansible in TripleO
Heat Templates: https://review.opendev.org/706850

It also sets the right permissions to only allow the deployment user to
read the file which container sensible credentials (cloud admin).

We also have to backport: I286c71edf120e11d8e51c792e6078dc60147f026

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706850/
Change-Id: I49b95bf7a03e39db3c2cbb91b2167c7645b09136
(cherry picked from commit ccd4c7f59f0884b16894018710f9ea5236c257d2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 15:07:56.000000000', 'message': "[train-squash] Backport keystone/bootstrap changes

Configure additional info during bootstrap

Keystone bootstrap can also be passed with additional endpoint
information. This will populate the initial catalog.

Change-Id: I3e9c1df82b4dfc94253688038215a66ded365a95
(cherry picked from commit eeec9a52eef2b7b83f0bf9c97a452c28979ce1e3)

keystone/bootstrap: fix identity service name

Service name for bootstrap should be named 'keystone' to match with what
Puppet creates, so we don't end up with multiple 'identity' services and
endpoints.

Change-Id: I9dc5bbd4de28e92e2b6161eb12cb92680f4363bd
(cherry picked from commit 32d3676e5f1bccb2f49d65aff134f18eda3c6722)

commit_message:
[train-squash] Backport keystone/bootstrap changes

Configure additional info during bootstrap

Keystone bootstrap can also be passed with additional endpoint
information. This will populate the initial catalog.

Change-Id: I3e9c1df82b4dfc94253688038215a66ded365a95
(cherry picked from commit eeec9a52eef2b7b83f0bf9c97a452c28979ce1e3)

keystone/bootstrap: fix identity service name

Service name for bootstrap should be named 'keystone' to match with what
Puppet creates, so we don't end up with multiple 'identity' services and
endpoints.

Change-Id: I9dc5bbd4de28e92e2b6161eb12cb92680f4363bd
(cherry picked from commit 32d3676e5f1bccb2f49d65aff134f18eda3c6722)

commit_message:
Deploy /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml with Ansible

Replace the python script that was run on post-config, by an Ansible
task running on the host where Keystone is running.

It'll be useful later when using OpenStackSDK to have access to the
credentials during the deployment and not having to wait the far end.

It's also reducing the Heat resources.

Change-Id: I585abc3e6a3b9b8ae9183e0b5170df2e39301e17
(cherry picked from commit 25a2045e6205d07f38cc6a065f9ad67b86ebe43d)

I don't believe this will break them, but they need to change that anyway, so this is required to be able to do that. Direct git URLs should not be used in requirements files."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-01-14 13:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I don't believe this will break them, but they need to change that
 > anyway, so this is required to be able to do that. Direct git URLs
 > should not be used in requirements files.

[0] was an example of the breakage, the error message there:

ERROR: Could not satisfy constraints for 'neutron': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Furthermore every(?) networking-* and neutron-* project have 'dev' tox target for local runs of tests which uses the line:

pip install -q -e "git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron@stable/stein#egg=neutron"

This will also fail with the above error if I'm not mistaken. I'm ok with introducing this change but that will involve some other changes I think.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-01-14 13:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2019-12-04 21:27:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron to upper-constraints

Some projects, notably neutron plugins, are using the neutron service as
a library. There is the neutron-lib package, but apparently they have
not moved everything needed over to there yet.

Updated to stable/stein maximum of 14.0.3

Change-Id: I8e95dc48b8ba2a7e16f1d34eb5ad0e87a3e96f4f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ba81a34bfc7b1c84895d7d4dd5ea5236871c0d86)
(cherry picked from commit dcde4e8ae33dca992fc56fe6d62411f54d612729)
'}, {'created': '2020-01-14 02:38:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron to stable upper-constraints

Some projects, notably neutron plugins, are using the neutron service as
a library. There is the neutron-lib package, but apparently they have
not moved everything needed over to there yet.

This is being added directly in stable branches only. Master needs to
get the latest version available, so these will need to be added at each
release so the stable branches use the correct version of neutron for
their respective stable release.

Change-Id: I8e95dc48b8ba2a7e16f1d34eb5ad0e87a3e96f4f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1d0f6fc806ec197beee808674c57a7aa6b281e81)
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron to stable upper-constraints

Some projects, notably neutron plugins, are using the neutron service as
a library. There is the neutron-lib package, but apparently they have
not moved everything needed over to there yet.

This is being added directly in stable branches only. Master needs to
get the latest version available, so these will need to be added at each
release so the stable branches use the correct version of neutron for
their respective stable release.

Change-Id: I8e95dc48b8ba2a7e16f1d34eb5ad0e87a3e96f4f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1d0f6fc806ec197beee808674c57a7aa6b281e81)

commit_message:
Fix the cryptography install.

The newton version is end of life but is still supported for the
downstream. Currently if you tried to run the unit tests on newton, you
can't. The cryptography can't compile. With this cryptography version
that compile and unit tests run well.

Change-Id: Ic58bd79a192e6624b63a640cb5189d6d0f816250

[{'created': '2020-02-07 16:13:06.000000000', 'message': "Do not append container_name for metal containers

dynamic_inventory.py fails in case of hostname+container_name length
is more than 52 symbols. While it's valid appriach for containers,
it shouldn't raise error when container is deployed on metal, since
nothing will be appended to it's current hostname.

Change-Id: Ifeed116a026042ae32985aaa7ff3f167ef3923f4
(cherry picked from commit 2a7edfb036dcba89b99bd5e1c3763aef7dbf7f28)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not append container_name for metal containers

dynamic_inventory.py fails in case of hostname+container_name length
is more than 52 symbols. While it's valid appriach for containers,
it shouldn't raise error when container is deployed on metal, since
nothing will be appended to it's current hostname.

Change-Id: Ifeed116a026042ae32985aaa7ff3f167ef3923f4
(cherry picked from commit 2a7edfb036dcba89b99bd5e1c3763aef7dbf7f28)

"}, {'created': '2020-02-14 03:06:26.000000000', 'message': "Solve py37 timeout

Py37 job always reports timeout error recently.
Please see [1] [2] [3].
At first it was suspected that the error was reported
because of the patch [4].
Therefore, Feng Shaohe's patch [5] revoked the merge,
and at this time, disappeared at py37 timeout.

But in fact, this problem is just hidden.
After removing this setting, the job of py37
is actually running on the environment of python 3.6
(community CI default version is 3.6), please see [6]
for detailed reasons.

Therefore, this patch exposes the hidden py37 timeout problem,
and at the same time, found method test_apply_patch_fpga_arq_monitor_job
, think it is the reason of the timeout. The reason I can find
this method is based on the the troubleshooting of tox -epy37 log.
After commenting out this method, I found that tox -epy37 can run
normally and there is no longer a timeout problem.

If you want to test, please ensure that you have a local
python3.7 environment, not 3.6, and execute rm .tox / -rf.
Then execute tox -epy37.

Therefore, the best way is to comment out this method and
restore py37 job at the same time.
If a friend discovers further reasons, this method can be
restored, please refer to [7].

What went wrong in this method? I personally suspect that it
is caused by deadlock or asynchronous waiting, just speculation.

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702578/
[2]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703049/
[3]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703253/
[4]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696397/
[5]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706911/

[7]. https://github.com/openstack/cyborg/tree/deed9c822e3dc54a522ede0d8fafda5890075803

Change-Id: I09db889fe665c6246ec9503af92c909e7d0da24f

and at this time, disappeared at py37 timeout.

But in fact, this problem is just hidden.
After removing this setting, the job of py37
is actually running on the environment of python 3.6
(community CI default version is 3.6), please see [6]
for detailed reasons.

Therefore, this patch exposes the hidden py37 timeout problem,
and at the same time, found method test_apply_patch_fpga_arq_monitor_job
, think it is the reason of the timeout. The reason I can find
this method is based on the the troubleshooting of tox -epy37 log.
After commenting out this method, I found that tox -epy37 can run
normally and there is no longer a timeout problem.

If you want to test, please ensure that you have a local
python3.7 environment, not 3.6, and execute rm .tox / -rf.
Then execute tox -epy37.

Therefore, the best way is to comment out this method and
restore py37 job at the same time.

If a friend discovers further reasons and solution, this method
can be restored, please refer to [7].

What went wrong in this method?
It is because in the deep call of this method, ThreadWork of
the thread pool will be used, which under Python3.7 will block
the execution of unit tests. For specific reasons, please see
[8] [9].

Reference:

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702578/

[8]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707045/5//COMMIT_MSG

commit_message:
Solve py37 timeout

Py37 job always reports timeout error recently.
Please see [1] [2] [3].
At first it was suspected that the error was reported
because of the patch [4].
Therefore, Feng Shaohe's patch [5] revoked the merge,
and at this time, disappeared at py37 timeout.

But in fact, this problem is just hidden.
After removing this setting, the job of py37
is actually running on the environment of python 3.6
(community CI default version is 3.6), please see [6]
for detailed reasons.

Therefore, this patch exposes the hidden py37 timeout problem,
and at the same time, found method test_apply_patch_fpga_arq_monitor_job
, think it is the reason of the timeout. The reason I can find
this method is based on the the troubleshooting of tox -epy37 log.
After commenting out this method, I found that tox -epy37 can run
normally and there is no longer a timeout problem.

If you want to test, please ensure that you have a local
python3.7 environment, not 3.6, and execute rm .tox / -rf.
Then execute tox -epy37.

Therefore, the best way is to comment out this method and
restore py37 job at the same time.

If a friend discovers further reasons and solution, this method
can be restored, please refer to [7].

What went wrong in this method?
It is because in the deep call of this method, ThreadWork of
the thread pool will be used, which under Python3.7 will block
the execution of unit tests. For specific reasons, please see
[8] [9].

Reference:

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702578/
[2]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703049/
[3]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703253/
[4]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696397/
[5]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706911/
[6]. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-02-12.log.html#t2020-02-12T16:46:18
[7]. https://github.com/openstack/cyborg/tree/deed9c822e3dc54a522ede0d8fafda5890075803
[8]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707045/5//COMMIT_MSG
[9]. https://github.com/openstack/cyborg/blob/c61dd8c37612c54456184212321c2c63237daac5/cyborg/objects/extarq/ext_arq_job.py#L41

Change-Id: I09db889fe665c6246ec9503af92c909e7d0da24f

[{'created': '2020-01-04 00:30:55.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Ignore DHCP port during DVR host query

For large scale deployment, the dvr router will be installed to
the scheduled DHCP host. This will definitely increase the l3
agent service pressure, especially in large number of concurrent
updates, creation, or agent restart.

This patch adds a config ``host_dvr_for_dhcp`` for the DHCP port
device_owner filter during DVR host query. Then if we set
``host_dvr_for_dhcp = False``, L3-agent will not host the DVR router
namespace in its connected networks' DHCP agent hosts.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/dvr_mac_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1609217
Change-Id: I53e20be9b306bf9d3b34ec6a31e3afabd5a0fd6f
(cherry picked from commit 8f057fb49ac637bd0dbf60ca07b89f0e4a59c7b7)
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Ignore DHCP port during DVR host query

For large scale deployment, the dvr router will be installed to
the scheduled DHCP host. This will definitely increase the l3
agent service pressure, especially in large number of concurrent
updates, creation, or agent restart.

This patch adds a config ``host_dvr_for_dhcp`` for the DHCP port
device_owner filter during DVR host query. Then if we set
``host_dvr_for_dhcp = False``, L3-agent will not host the DVR router
namespace in its connected networks' DHCP agent hosts.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/dvr_mac_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1609217
Change-Id: I53e20be9b306bf9d3b34ec6a31e3afabd5a0fd6f
(cherry picked from commit 8f057fb49ac637bd0dbf60ca07b89f0e4a59c7b7)

commit_message:
demarcate python-memcached requirements

To support Python3, we need python-memcached 1.58 or above. However,
projects such as keystonemiddleware[1] have python-memcached 1.56
in its lower-constraints.txt. For stable/stein, Python3 is now the
defult[2]. However, we generally avoid changing lower constraints in
the stable branches so we don't inadvertently break the downstream
consumers. Therefore, we need to separate python-memcached requirement
for the respective python versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/stable/stein/lower-constraints.txt#L61
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/stein/python3-first.html

NOTE: in addition to the original backport, this patch also introduce the
following changes:

1. cap gunicorn version to less than 20.0.0 as the later versions
no longer support Python2.
2. cap exabgp version to 4.1.0 as later versions have invalid
metadata file.
3. cap libvirt-python to less than 6.0.0 as later versions no longer
support Python2.

Change-Id: Ifb805954ff36420004d552a690046d8ddf3bed5c

projects such as keystonemiddleware[1] have python-memcached 1.56
in its lower-constraints.txt. For stable/stein, Python3 is now the
defult[2]. However, we generally avoid changing lower constraints in
the stable branches so we don't inadvertently break the downstream
consumers. Therefore, we need to separate python-memcached requirement
for the respective python versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/stable/stein/lower-constraints.txt#L61
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/stein/python3-first.html

NOTE: in addition to the original backport, this patch also
cap libvirt-python to less than 6.0.0 as later versions no longer
support Python2.

Change-Id: Ifb805954ff36420004d552a690046d8ddf3bed5c
"}]
commit_message:
demarcate python-memcached requirements

To support Python3, we need python-memcached 1.58 or above. However,
projects such as keystonemiddleware[1] have python-memcached 1.56
in its lower-constraints.txt. For stable/stein, Python3 is now the
defult[2]. However, we generally avoid changing lower constraints in
the stable branches so we don't inadvertently break the downstream
consumers. Therefore, we need to separate python-memcached requirement
for the respective python versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/stable/stein/lower-constraints.txt#L61
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/stein/python3-first.html

NOTE: in addition to the original backport, this patch also
cap libvirt-python to less than 6.0.0 as later versions no longer
support Python2.

Change-Id: Ifb805954ff36420004d552a690046d8ddf3bed5c

commit_message:
Bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in UC

Diskimage-builder (DIB) is a branch-less project. Unfortunately pip
made a change that required a modification to DIB[1]. This patch was
first released in DIB 2.30.0.
To fix image building on the OpenStack stable branches, we need to
bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in the upper-constraints.txt of
the stable OpenStack releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695823/

Change-Id: I4ef04c4fad5ffa0ba195fe6975397d9bb4afc70c

commit_message:
Add dependency for enable KSM for RHEL/CentOS8

With the OS change to version 8, the qemu-kvm-common package
name changed to just qemu-kvm-common instead of qemu-kvm-common-ev
or qemu-kvm-common-rhev. This adds a condition for the major
OS version.

Change-Id: Idd69c687232a10fcb6db79a8b835a1576b7558dd
Closes-Bug: #1862921
(cherry picked from commit cfb00c9cfe7656d307b6504197feb600a177e431)

[{'created': '2020-02-07 16:12:50.000000000', 'message': "Do not append container_name for metal containers

dynamic_inventory.py fails in case of hostname+container_name length
is more than 52 symbols. While it's valid appriach for containers,

"}]
commit_message:
Do not append container_name for metal containers

dynamic_inventory.py fails in case of hostname+container_name length
is more than 52 symbols. While it's valid appriach for containers,
it shouldn't raise error when container is deployed on metal, since
nothing will be appended to it's current hostname.

Change-Id: Ifeed116a026042ae32985aaa7ff3f167ef3923f4
(cherry picked from commit 2a7edfb036dcba89b99bd5e1c3763aef7dbf7f28)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-15 18:02:09.000000000', 'message': 'Drop virtualenv pip package for CI

As CI images have pre-installed latest virtualenv package wich breaks
deployments. This will ensure that this package will be dropped and
appropriate one will be installed later.

This also makes ubuntu use appropriate python3 venv tooling and
drops py2 packages installation

Additionally virtualenv is dropped from requirements and ubuntu
upgrade jobs is marked as non-voting until backporting change
to previous release

Change-Id: I50931e0f68176bbaebfb68eec9f84241816c7fe3
(cherry picked from commit 3800754c1fa98d8d6ec32cf86398a12cf62a8e43)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop virtualenv pip package for CI

As CI images have pre-installed latest virtualenv package wich breaks
deployments. This will ensure that this package will be dropped and
appropriate one will be installed later.

This also makes ubuntu use appropriate python3 venv tooling and
drops py2 packages installation

Additionally virtualenv is dropped from requirements and ubuntu
upgrade jobs is marked as non-voting until backporting change
to previous release

Change-Id: I50931e0f68176bbaebfb68eec9f84241816c7fe3

commit_message:
[WIP]Support aep, sst at node property of ironic-inspector
    aep is implemented as property
    sst is implemented as cpu capabilities, 'bf' was
    cpu flag for this

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

zun-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: If4cec36beab64c83a59ebc7cf5c98f3d15ba328b

Change-Id: I07b4fdf5beedc3480afb9ca0a41252c11084dc12
"}]
commit_message:
switch tempest job to py3 version

old version installed neutron from master (with constraints, but
neutron is unconstrained in master because plugins need it).  This
was fine when neutron/master supported py2, but it doesn't anymore.

Change-Id: I07b4fdf5beedc3480afb9ca0a41252c11084dc12

Provide a command that doesn't use playbook to debug a container, just
pure Ansible CLI.
